title: Iphigenia by Euripides (1977) dir Michael Cacoyannis
description:
Iphigenia by Euripides (1977 , released by Olive Films 2016)

IMDb   tt0076208
 
Greek dialogue; selectable English subtitles.

Runtime 127 minutes

Michael Cacoyannis   director.

Cast 	

Irene Pappas,        Clytemnestra
Costo Kazakos,       Agamemnon
Tatiana Papamoskou   Iphigenia

Summary 	

"Believed to be cursed by a powerful and angry goddess for his slaying of a deer, 
Agamemnon must sacrifice his daughter Iphigenia to remove the curse which has 
prevented the winds from blowing and his ships from moving forward on their 
mission to Troy."

My notes

   This is another film from the many made by the Greek director Michael 
Cacoyannis of the Greek tragedies.  Irene Papas appears as Clytemnestra.  Pappas 
as Elektra by Sophocles and  directed by Cacoyannis is also in my group file 
shares on TPB under loninappleton.

   The style of the film is idyllic rather than stark for most of the film.  It has the sweep and large historical canvas of more popular dramas of the period and was released by MGM. 

   The subtitles contain the translation to English of the play, not the normal dialog of a modern day version of historical drama.

   Though I have scant knowledge of Greek drama I have become familiar with the 
work of Brian Doeries translations.  Doeries was trained in the classics and has 
a volume of translations newly published (2016)  called "All That You See Here Is 
God."  I note them not for a translation of Iphigenia but for what Doeries brings as a modern translator to the work.  

   The selectable subtitles are accessed through your media player such as VLC by 
Videolan
